That is why I voted against supporting House Resolution 719. 

Unfortunately, that resolution goes far beyond condemning violence—it attempts to sanitize and praise aspects of Mr. Kirk’s legacy, despite his record of distorting and lambasting the legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. and making highly charged, racist claims about Black people, our communities, our lifestyles, and even our intelligence.

Today, I introduced the Affordable Inhalers and Nebulizers Act, alongside Senator Alsobrooks, to make life-saving #asthma and #COPD medications more accessible and affordable for all Americans.

This bill will cap out-of-pocket costs for inhalers and nebulizers at $15 per month for Medicare beneficiaries, private insurance holders, and uninsured individuals. It’s a step toward health equity—addressing racial and economic disparities while ensuring no family has to choose between breathing and basic needs.

Thank you to @NationalMedAssn, the Maryland Citizen’s Health Initiative, and the Asthma and Allergy Foundation of America for supporting this important legislation.

Let’s strive toward a future where affordable respiratory care is a reality.

#AffordableCare #Inhalers #COPD #AsthmaRelief #HealthEquity
